intro: Thlaspi vulgatum, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows up to 60 cm tall, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from April to July. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often reddish in color. Thlaspi vulgatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
